text:

The Chennai City police arrested a youth for stealing a surveillance camera from an automated teller machine kiosk of a nationalised bank at Perumbakkam, a suburb, on Tuesday.

Police sources gave the name of the accused as R. Pandi (25) of Padappai, who was employed at a UPS service provider company.

The police said that he attempted to withdraw money from the ATM and, annoyed that the machine was not dispensing the cash, removed the surveillance camera from the machine and fled the scene. The manager of the nationalised bank filed a complaint and the Pallikaranai police found that the surveillance cameras fixed in the neighbourhood had recorded the incident.

He was nabbed when he revisited the ATM kiosk next day and placed the camera inside.

The accused man was produced in court on Friday and sent to the Puzhal prison.

The police nabbed him the next day when he revisited the ATM to return the camera
title: Youth held for stealing camera from ATM
